qas.question: What bankrupt company did Comcast partner with another broadband provider to acquire in 2005?
Who was Comcast's partner in the deal for Adelphia?
What was the price to take over Adelphia?
What government organization investigated details of this acquisition?
How long did it take for Adelphia Cable to go bankrupt?
Who partnered with Comcast to buy out Time Warner?
How much did the FCC charge Comcast and Time Warner for the investigation?
When did the FCC object to the deal?

context: In <b9_0>April 2005<b9_0/>, Comcast and <a1_0>Time Warner Cable<a1_0/> announced plans to buy the assets of bankrupted <a0_0><b6_0>Adelphia Cable<b6_0/><a0_0/>. The two companies paid a total of <a2_0><b7_0>$17.6 billion<b7_0/><a2_0/> in the deal that was finalized in <b8_0>the <a4_0>second quarter of 2006<b8_0/><a4_0/>—after <a3_0>the U.S. Federal Communications Commission<a3_0/> (FCC) completed a <b5_0>seven-month<b5_0/> investigation without raising an objection. Time Warner Cable became the second largest cable provider in the U.S., ranking behind Comcast. As part of the deal, Time Warner and Comcast traded existing subscribers in order to consolidate them into larger geographic clusters.
